author: Staff Reporter
text:
The gaur, a protected animal, was hunted for its horn and skin inside the Arasampet Reserve Forest

Personnel attached to Odugathur Forest Range have arrested two persons for hunting an Indian gaur inside Arasampet Reserve Forest. They killed the animal protected under Schedule 1 of the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972 for its horn and skin.

Officials said that the range office had received a tip-off that men were involved in hunting on the evening of February 12. A team of 20 persons, led by Odugathur Range Officer R. Muralidharan, rushed to the RF and launched a search. They found the carcass of the Indian gaur hidden under a bush.

They nabbed two persons – Kathavarayan (24) and Sekar alias Senthamarai (55) of Melarasampattu on the next day and recovered a country-made gun from them. They were produced before the Judicial Magistrate III, Vellore, and remanded.

Forest department officers said Indian gaur was a protected species, and the hunted animal was the only one spotted in this forest range.“They had shot the animal in its chest. They had cut its head and hid the carcass under a bush,” M. Babu, forester, Odugathur range said. The duo said that they were planning to remove the bison’s horn and skin and sell them.
title: Two held for hunting Indian gaur
